eventsList.heading: March to end injustice unites students and community
eventsList.bio: UNC Charlotte students gathered on Saturday, June 6, for the first time since leaving campus in March due to the COVID-19 pandemic to lead and participate in the March to End Injustice. The peaceful, three-mile march from North Tryon Street and J.W. Clay Boulevard to the Popp Martin Student Union was organized by students in response to the death of George Floyd, who died while he was handcuffed and forcibly restrained by officers from the Minneapolis Police Department on May 25. It is one of many demonstrations taking place in Charlotte and other cities nationwide since Floyd, who was black, died and the police officers involved were charged with his murder.

eventsList.heading: Islamic awareness week
eventsList.bio: American Islamic Outreach Foundation collaborated with UNCC MSA during the Islamic Awareness Week by providing the Clear Quran Translations and Brochures on many different subjects for the Information Table. Islamic Club also provides services to Muslim students and works with the small Muslim community.

eventsList.bio: Students filled the Student Union rotunda in peaceful protest Wednesday afternoon. â€“ Sep 21, 2016

eventsList.heading: Across Mecklenburg County, hundreds march in 9th day of George Floyd protests
eventsList.bio: Eli Healy, 5, sits on the shoulders of Brelin Fasion-Walden, a UNCC football player, at a student-led march around UNC Charlotte on Saturday. The marchers protested the death of George Floyd during his arrest in Minnesota.
